Code¶

peakipy.core.gaussian(x, center=0.0, sigma=1.0)[source]¶

1-dimensional Gaussian function.

gaussian(x, center, sigma) =

(1/(s2pi*sigma)) * exp(-(1.0*x-center)**2 / (2*sigma**2))

\(\frac{1}{ \sqrt{2\pi} } exp \left( \frac{-(x-center)^2}{2 \sigma^2} \right)\)

Parameters

  • x (numpy.array) – x

  • center (float) – center

  • sigma (float) – sigma

Returns

1-dimensional Gaussian

Return type

numpy.array

peakipy.core.lorentzian(x, center=0.0, sigma=1.0)[source]¶

1-dimensional Lorentzian function.

lorentzian(x, center, sigma) =

(1/(1 + ((1.0*x-center)/sigma)**2)) / (pi*sigma)

\(\frac{1}{ 1+ \left( \frac{x-center}{\sigma}\right)^2} / (\pi\sigma)\)

Parameters

  • x (numpy.array) – x

  • center (float) – center

  • sigma (float) – sigma

Returns

1-dimensional Lorenztian

Return type

numpy.array

peakipy.core.voigt(x, center=0.0, sigma=1.0, gamma=None)[source]¶

Return a 1-dimensional Voigt function.

voigt(x, center, sigma, gamma) =

amplitude*wofz(z).real / (sigma*sqrt(2.0 * π))

\(V(x,\sigma,\gamma) = (\frac{Re[\omega(z)]}{\sigma \sqrt{2\pi}})\)

\(z=\frac{x+i\gamma}{\sigma\sqrt{2}}\)

see Voigt wiki

Parameters

  • x (numpy array 1d) – x values

  • center (float) – center of lineshape in points

  • sigma (float) – sigma of gaussian

  • gamma (float) – gamma of lorentzian

Returns

Voigt lineshape

Return type

numpy.array

peakipy.core.pseudo_voigt(x, center=0.0, sigma=1.0, fraction=0.5)[source]¶

1-dimensional Pseudo-voigt function

Superposition of Gaussian and Lorentzian function

\((1-\phi) G(x,center,\sigma_g) + \phi L(x, center, \sigma)\)

Where \(\phi\) is the fraction of Lorentzian lineshape and \(G\) and \(L\) are Gaussian and Lorentzian functions, respectively.

Parameters

  • x (numpy.array) – data

  • center (float) – center of peak

  • sigma (float) – sigma of lineshape

  • fraction (float) – fraction of lorentzian lineshape (between 0 and 1)

Returns

pseudo-voigt function

Return type

numpy.array

peakipy.core.pvoigt2d(XY, amplitude=1.0, center_x=0.5, center_y=0.5, sigma_x=1.0, sigma_y=1.0, fraction=0.5)[source]¶

2D pseudo-voigt model

\((1-fraction) G(x,center,\sigma_{gx}) + (fraction) L(x, center, \sigma_x) * (1-fraction) G(y,center,\sigma_{gy}) + (fraction) L(y, center, \sigma_y)\)

Parameters

  • XY (numpy.array) – meshgrid of X and Y coordinates [X,Y] each with shape Z

  • amplitude (float) – amplitude of peak

  • center_x (float) – center of peak in x

  • center_y (float) – center of peak in x

  • sigma_x (float) – sigma of lineshape in x

  • sigma_y (float) – sigma of lineshape in y

  • fraction (float) – fraction of lorentzian lineshape (between 0 and 1)

Returns

flattened array of Z values (use Z.reshape(X.shape) for recovery)

Return type

numpy.array

peakipy.core.make_models(model, peaks, data, lineshape='PV', xy_bounds=None)[source]¶

Make composite models for multiple peaks

Parameters

  • model (function) – lineshape function

  • peaks (pandas.df.groupby("CLUSTID")) – instance of pandas.df.groupby(“CLUSTID”)

  • data (numpy.array) – NMR data

  • lineshape (str) – lineshape to use for fit (PV/G/L/PV_PV)

  • xy_bounds (tuple) – bounds for peak centers (+/-x, +/-y)

Return mod

Composite lmfit model containing all peaks

Rtype mod

lmfit.CompositeModel

Return p_guess

params for composite model with starting values

Rtype p_guess

lmfit.Parameters

peakipy.core.make_mask(data, c_x, c_y, r_x, r_y)[source]¶

Create and elliptical mask

Generate an elliptical boolean mask with center c_x/c_y in points with radii r_x and r_y. Used to generate fit mask

Parameters

  • data (np.array) – 2D array

  • c_x (float) – x center

  • c_y (float) – y center

  • r_x (float) – radius in x

  • r_y (float) – radius in y

Returns

boolean mask of data.shape

Return type

numpy.array

peakipy.core.fit_first_plane(group, data, uc_dics, lineshape='PV', xy_bounds=None, verbose=False, log=None, noise=1.0, fit_method='leastsq')[source]¶

Deconvolute group of peaks

Parameters

  • group (pandas.core.groupby.generic.DataFrameGroupBy) – pandas data from containing group of peaks using groupby(“CLUSTID”)

  • data (numpy.array) – NMR data

  • uc_dics (dict) – nmrglue unit conversion dics {“f1”:uc_f1,”f2”:uc_f2}

  • lineshape (str) – lineshape to fit (PV, G, L, V, G_L, PV_L, PV_G or PV_PV)

  • xy_bounds (tuple) – set bounds on x y positions. None or (x_bound, y_bound)

  • plot (str) – dir to save wireframe plots

  • show (bool) – interactive matplotlib plot

  • verbose (bool) – print what is happening to terminal

  • log (str) – file

  • noise (float) – estimate of spectral noise for calculation of \(\chi^2\) and \(\chi^2_{red}\)

  • fit_method (str) – method used by lmfit

Returns

FitResult

Return type

FitResult

Update lmfit parameters with values from Peak

  • param_dict (dict) – parameters corresponding to each peak in fit

  • xy_bounds (tuple) – bounds on xy peak positions

Returns

None

None

class peakipy.core.Pseudo3D(dic, data, dims)[source]¶

Read dic, data from NMRGlue and dims from input to create a Pseudo3D dataset

Parameters

  • dic (dict) – from nmrglue.pipe.read

  • data (numpy.array) – data from nmrglue.pipe.read

  • dims (list) – dimension order i.e [0,1,2] where 0 = planes, 1 = f1, 2 = f2
